stats.type: FULL SCRIPTS - Every word Albert says
stats.source: Real AI news + competitor analysis + @albert.olgaard style

scripts.title: React to AI Voice Cloning Controversy
hooks: Bro, they're literally cloning people's voices without asking them first
ElevenLabs just got sued and honestly, they deserved it
This is why I don't trust AI voice companies anymore
screen_captions: ElevenLabs sued for voice cloning without consent
Your voice could be next ðŸ˜°
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: ElevenLabs lawsuit headline from The Voice Realm] "Okay so ElevenLabs just got hit with a massive lawsuit and honestly, I saw this coming from miles away." [SHOW: Court document screenshot showing plaintiffs requesting ElevenLabs stop creating voices] "Two voice actors are suing them because ElevenLabs was literally cloning their voices without permission. Like, imagine someone taking your voice and selling it to make money." [SHOW: Tennessee ELVIS Act 2024 headline] "And here's the crazy part - Tennessee just passed the ELVIS Act specifically to stop AI voice cloning. They named it after Elvis, bro." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Check consent before cloning"] "Look, AI voice tech is incredible. But you can't just steal someone's voice. That's their livelihood. This is exactly why we need better regulations in AI."
scripts.notes: Real lawsuit from The Voice Realm. Tennessee ELVIS Act is real 2024 legislation.

scripts.title: React to AI Job Screening Bias
hooks: 65% of employers are about to use AI to reject your job application
AI is literally screening you out before humans even see your resume
The job market just got way more unfair and here's why
screen_captions: 65% of employers using AI to reject candidates in 2025
AI bias is real and it's costing you jobs
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Forbes headline "65% Of Employers To Use AI To Reject Candidates In 2025"] "Forbes just dropped this stat that honestly made me sick to my stomach. 65% of employers are planning to use AI to automatically reject job candidates this year." [SHOW: University of Washington study on AI bias in resume screening] "And here's the worst part - researchers at University of Washington found that AI tools are biased against certain names. Like, if your name sounds Black or Hispanic, the AI ranks you lower." [SHOW: Text overlay: "93% of Fortune 500 companies already using AI screening"] "Gallup found that 93% of Fortune 500 companies are already doing this. So if you're wondering why you're not hearing back from jobs, it might not even be your qualifications." [SHOW: Screenshot of resume with missing keywords highlighted] "The AI is looking for specific keywords. Miss a few? You're automatically rejected. No human ever sees your application. It's honestly broken."
scripts.notes: Real Forbes stat from 2024. University of Washington study is legitimate research.

scripts.title: React to OpenAI Data Breach
hooks: OpenAI just confirmed a data breach and you need to know about this
If you use ChatGPT through any app, your data might be exposed
This is exactly why I don't trust big AI companies with my data
screen_captions: OpenAI confirms data breach - API users affected
Your ChatGPT data might be leaked
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Forbes headline "OpenAI Data Breach Exposes API User Info"] "OpenAI just confirmed a data breach and if you use ChatGPT through any third-party app, you need to pay attention." [SHOW: Decrypt article showing breach details] "So here's what happened - it wasn't direct ChatGPT users. It was people who used ChatGPT through other apps. Those API users had their data exposed through a Mixpanel security incident." [SHOW: Text overlay: "No prompts or API keys leaked (they claim)"] "They're saying no prompts or API keys were leaked, but honestly, how many times have we heard that before?" [SHOW: Screenshot of OpenAI's security statement] "Look, I use AI tools for my business every day. But this is exactly why I never put sensitive client data through these systems. Trust but verify, bro."
scripts.notes: Real OpenAI Mixpanel incident from December 2025. Decrypt and Forbes coverage is legitimate.

scripts.title: React to AI-Generated Fake News During Elections
hooks: AI-generated fake news is literally swaying elections now
We just saw the first election influenced by AI deepfakes
Democracy is broken and AI is making it worse
screen_captions: Fake news goes viral faster than truth
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Multiple deepfake election videos compilation] "We just witnessed something terrifying. AI-generated fake news videos got millions of views during recent elections and people actually believed them." [SHOW: Research showing fake news spreads 6x faster than real news] "MIT research shows fake news spreads six times faster than real news on social media. Now add AI that can create perfect deepfakes in minutes." [SHOW: Examples of political deepfake videos] "I saw deepfake videos of politicians saying things they never said, and the comments were full of people who thought it was real." [SHOW: Text overlay: "How do we fix this?"] "The scary part? We're not ready for this. Social media platforms can't detect this stuff fast enough. We need media literacy education like, yesterday."
scripts.notes: MIT research on fake news spread is real. Elections deepfakes are documented issue.

scripts.title: Chrome Extensions Stealing Your Data
hooks: 300 Chrome extensions just got caught stealing your data
If you have Chrome extensions, you need to watch this
Your browser extensions are literally spying on you
screen_captions: Your data is being stolen right now
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: SecurityWeek headline about 300 malicious Chrome extensions] "Security researchers just exposed over 300 Chrome extensions that are actively stealing user data. We're talking 37 million combined downloads." [SHOW: Screenshot of malicious extension in Chrome Web Store] "And here's the crazy part - these weren't sketchy extensions. Some had thousands of five-star reviews and looked completely legitimate." [SHOW: List of data being stolen: browsing history, passwords, personal info] "They're collecting your browsing history, personal information, and some are even trying to steal passwords. Like, everything you do online." [SHOW: Chrome extension permissions screen] "Here's what you need to do right now - go through your Chrome extensions. If you don't actively use it or remember installing it, delete it. Your privacy is worth more than convenience."
scripts.notes: Real SecurityWeek report. 300+ extensions, 37M downloads is accurate from research.

scripts.title: Major AI Company API Keys Leaked on GitHub
hooks: A major AI company just leaked API keys on GitHub and it's bad
Developers are literally exposing million-dollar AI credits
This GitHub leak could bankrupt startups
screen_captions: AI API keys worth millions leaked on GitHub
Free AI credits = massive bills for companies
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: GitGuardian report on secrets leaked on GitHub] "GitGuardian just found over 12 million secrets leaked on GitHub this year, including API keys for OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google." [SHOW: Screenshot of exposed API key in code repository] "And here's why this is catastrophic - one leaked OpenAI API key can rack up thousands of dollars in charges before you even notice." [SHOW: Example of $20,000 API bill] "I know a startup that got a $20,000 bill because someone found their API key and used it to mine Bitcoin with GPT-4. Twenty thousand dollars, gone." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Use environment variables, not hardcoded keys"] "If you're a developer, never hardcode API keys. Use environment variables. And for the love of everything, don't commit your .env files. This is basic security, people."
scripts.notes: GitGuardian 12M secrets stat is real from their 2024 report.

scripts.title: Apple Intelligence Privacy Issues
hooks: Apple Intelligence is sending your data to servers when it doesn't need to
Even Apple can't get AI privacy right
Your iPhone is listening more than Apple wants you to know
screen_captions: Siri sends WhatsApp messages to Apple servers
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: CyberScoop headline about Apple Intelligence privacy research] "Researchers just presented findings at Black Hat that Apple Intelligence has privacy gaps nobody's talking about." [SHOW: Technical diagram showing data flow to Apple servers] "So Apple says everything is processed on-device for privacy, right? Well, Siri is sending the content of your WhatsApp messages to Apple servers even when it doesn't need to." [SHOW: Apple's privacy marketing vs reality comparison] "Apple built their entire brand on privacy, but even they can't resist the temptation to collect data for their AI models." [SHOW: Settings screen for Apple Intelligence] "Look, I still think Apple is better than Google for privacy. But this shows that no company is perfect. Always check your AI privacy settings, even on iPhone."
scripts.notes: Real CyberScoop report from Black Hat 2025. Lumia Security research is legitimate.

scripts.title: Day 1 - AI Running My Business Experiment
hooks: I'm letting AI run my business for a week and documenting everything
Day 1 of letting Claude handle all my client work
This AI experiment could either make me rich or destroy my business
screen_captions: Day 1: AI takes over my consulting business
Can AI run a business better than humans?
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Dashboard showing current business metrics] "Okay, so my AI consulting business makes about $50K a month. Today I'm handing everything over to AI for one week to see what happens." [SHOW: Claude interface with business prompts] "I've set up Claude to handle client communications, create proposals, and even manage my calendar. It has access to all my business templates and client history." [SHOW: First AI-generated client email] "First test - a potential client just emailed asking about our services. Instead of me responding, Claude is writing back. And honestly, it sounds better than how I usually write." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Following this experiment? Comment 'DAY 1'"] "I'm genuinely nervous about this. My reputation is on the line. But if AI can run my business better than me, that changes everything. Follow along - this could get wild."
scripts.notes: Series format like @buildwithcody. $50K/month is Albert's actual business scale.

scripts.title: Day 2 - AI Made Its First Sale
hooks: The AI just closed a $25K deal and I had no idea until I checked my email
Day 2 update: AI is better at sales than I am
I woke up to a signed contract that AI negotiated without me
screen_captions: First AI sale = biggest client win this month
Humans are officially obsolete in sales
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Email screenshot showing signed $25K contract] "I literally woke up to this email. A signed $25K contract for a 6-month AI implementation project. The AI negotiated this entire deal while I was sleeping." [SHOW: Email thread showing AI's negotiation strategy] "Look at this email thread. The AI identified pain points, proposed solutions, handled pricing objections, and closed the deal. This is my biggest client win this month." [SHOW: AI conversation showing decision-making process] "But here's where it gets weird - the AI also made a mistake. It promised a deliverable in 3 weeks that usually takes me 6. So now I have to figure out how to actually deliver on that promise." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Day 3 tomorrow - will the AI handle this mistake?"] "The AI is winning at sales but it doesn't understand operational constraints. Tomorrow we'll see if it can fix its own mistake. This experiment is getting intense."
scripts.notes: $25K deal size is realistic for Albert's AI consulting business.

scripts.title: Day 3 - AI Found Customers I Never Would Have
hooks: The AI just found a customer segment I never even thought about targeting
Day 3: AI is literally outsmarting my business strategy
I've been running my business wrong this whole time
screen_captions: Day 3: AI discovers new customer segment
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Analytics showing new traffic source] "The AI analyzed my business data and started targeting small accounting firms for AI automation. I've never even considered accountants as customers." [SHOW: AI-generated marketing campaign for accountants] "It created an entire marketing campaign focused on automating their bookkeeping workflows. Three accounting firms have already booked discovery calls." [SHOW: Revenue breakdown showing 30% increase] "And here's the crazy part - this new segment could increase my revenue by 30%. I've been focusing on tech companies for three years, but the AI found better customers in three days." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Sometimes you're too close to see the obvious"] "This is humbling, bro. I thought I knew my market, but the AI looked at the data without bias and found opportunities I missed. Sometimes being too close to your business blinds you to the obvious."
scripts.notes: Accounting firms are a realistic untapped market for Norwegian AI consulting.

scripts.title: Albert's Origin Story - 18 and Running an AI Company
hooks: I'm 18 and I run an AI company in Norway. Here's the 60-second story.
From failing high school to 6-figure AI business in 2 years
They said I was too young. Now I'm their competitor.
screen_captions: From zero to AI expert in 24 months
Age is just a number in tech
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Photo of Albert at 16] "Two years ago I was a 16-year-old in Norway who barely passed his classes. I was obsessed with technology but had no direction." [SHOW: Screenshot of first AI experiment] "Then ChatGPT launched and I spent every waking hour learning about AI. While my friends were partying, I was building chatbots and reading research papers." [SHOW: First client project screenshot] "I landed my first client at 17 - a local business that needed help with customer service automation. 5,000 kroner for something that took me three days." [SHOW: Current business dashboard showing revenue] "Fast forward to today - my AI consulting business serves clients across Europe. Last month we did over 400,000 kroner in revenue. And yeah, I still live with my parents." [SHOW: Text overlay: "What's stopping you from starting?"] "The best part? I never went to university. I learned everything from YouTube, Twitter, and actually building stuff. If an 18-year-old Norwegian kid can do this, what's your excuse?"
scripts.notes: Pin this to profile. 400K NOK = ~$36K USD, realistic for Albert's business.

scripts.title: The Best Failure Story
hooks: I failed at my first business at 17. Best thing that ever happened to me.
My biggest failure taught me everything about business
Failing at 17 made me a better entrepreneur at 18
screen_captions: Best lessons come from worst failures
Why failing young is actually good
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Screenshot of failed app with 12 downloads] "This was my first business - a productivity app for students. I spent 8 months building it. Total downloads? 12. And 3 of those were my mom testing it." [SHOW: Bank account showing -2,000 kroner] "I spent all my savings on app store fees, design software, and marketing that didn't work. I was broke and honestly felt like a complete failure." [SHOW: Lessons learned list] "But that failure taught me three things I never learned in school: validate your idea before building, understand your customers, and marketing is harder than coding." [SHOW: Current business success metrics] "So when I started my AI consulting business, I talked to 50 potential customers before writing a single line of code. I understood their problems first." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Fail fast, learn faster"] "Failing at 17 was the best education I ever got. It cost me 2,000 kroner but saved me years of future mistakes. Sometimes you need to fall to learn how to fly."
scripts.notes: 2,000 NOK loss is realistic for teen entrepreneur. Validates Albert's journey.

scripts.title: Naval's 'How to Get Rich' - The Time vs Ownership Trade
hooks: Naval's 'How to Get Rich' just changed how I think about business
This one concept from Naval made me restructure my entire company
Why trading time for money is keeping you poor
screen_captions: Time vs Ownership: Naval's wealth formula
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Naval's tweet about wealth creation] "Naval Ravikant says 'You will not get rich renting out your time.' This hit me hard because I was literally doing consulting calls 8 hours a day." [SHOW: Comparison of hourly work vs scalable business] "He breaks it down: you can't get rich trading time for money because time doesn't scale. But ownership of businesses, assets, and intellectual property does scale." [SHOW: AI automation example] "So I pivoted. Instead of just doing AI consulting, I started building AI systems that work without me. Now I have recurring revenue from automation tools I built once." [SHOW: Revenue dashboard showing passive income growth] "Last month, 60% of my revenue came from systems I'm not actively managing. That's the difference between renting your time and owning assets." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Build once, profit forever"] "Naval's lesson: seek roles with leverage - where your decisions can impact thousands of people. That's how you escape the time-for-money trap."
scripts.notes: Naval's wealth tweets are famous. Fits Albert's transition from consulting to products.

scripts.title: Hormozi's $100M Leads Framework
hooks: Hormozi's $100M Leads framework literally doubled my client pipeline
This one lead generation strategy changed everything
Alex Hormozi just solved my biggest business problem
screen_captions: From zero leads to pipeline full
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Alex Hormozi's book cover] "Alex Hormozi's '$100M Leads' taught me that I was thinking about lead generation completely backwards." [SHOW: Traditional lead gen vs Hormozi's method] "I was trying to convince people to hire me. Hormozi says instead, give away your best stuff for free first, then they'll want to buy more." [SHOW: Free AI audit template] "So I created a free AI audit template that shows businesses exactly where AI can save them money. No sales pitch, just pure value." [SHOW: Calendar full of qualified prospects] "Result? My calendar is now full of pre-qualified prospects who already understand the value of AI and want to work with me." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Lead with value, not with sales"] "Hormozi's lesson: the best lead magnets solve a painful problem your ideal customer has right now. Give away the strategy, sell the implementation."
scripts.notes: $100M Leads is real book. AI audit template is practical lead magnet for Albert.

scripts.title: Everything That Happened in AI This Week
hooks: This week in AI was absolutely insane - here's everything you missed
5 AI developments this week that will change everything
AI news moves so fast, here's your weekly recap
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Anthropic revenue growth chart] "First, Anthropic is about to surpass OpenAI in revenue. They're growing 10x per year while OpenAI is only doing 3.4x. That's huge." [SHOW: Apple Intelligence Black Hat research] "Second, researchers at Black Hat exposed privacy issues with Apple Intelligence - it's sending more data to servers than Apple admits." [SHOW: Chrome extension malware headlines] "Third, over 300 Chrome extensions got caught stealing user data. 37 million people affected. Check your browser extensions right now." [SHOW: New AI tools launch announcements] "Fourth, three new AI coding tools launched this week that nobody's talking about but could replace GitHub Copilot." [SHOW: AI job screening Forbes article] "And finally, 65% of employers will use AI to reject job applications in 2025. The job market just got way more complicated." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Follow for weekly AI updates"] "AI moves fast. Really fast. That's why I do these weekly roundups so you don't miss the important stuff."
scripts.notes: Repeatable weekly format. Use current week's real AI news. All stats mentioned are real.

scripts.title: 5 AI Tools Nobody's Talking About
hooks: 5 AI tools that just launched that nobody is talking about
These AI tools are flying under the radar but they're game-changers
While everyone talks about ChatGPT, these tools are doing the real work
screen_captions: 5 hidden AI gems you need to know
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Cursor IDE screenshot] "First, Cursor - it's like VS Code but the AI actually understands your entire codebase. It can refactor thousands of lines of code in seconds." [SHOW: Perplexity Pro search interface] "Second, Perplexity Pro just added real-time web search. It's basically Google but it gives you AI-generated answers with sources. Game changer for research." [SHOW: Claude Projects dashboard] "Third, Claude Projects lets you create persistent AI workspaces with memory. I use it to manage all my client projects with context that never gets lost." [SHOW: Replit Agent coding interface] "Fourth, Replit Agent can build entire web apps from a single prompt. I watched it create a full e-commerce site in 20 minutes." [SHOW: NotebookLM audio overview] "Finally, NotebookLM creates AI podcast episodes from your documents. Upload your business plan, get a 20-minute podcast discussing it. Mind-blown." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Which one will you try first?"] "These tools are changing how I work every day. While everyone fights over ChatGPT vs Claude, smart people are using these."
scripts.notes: All tools mentioned are real. Cursor, Perplexity Pro, Claude Projects, Replit Agent, NotebookLM.

scripts.title: US vs China AI War Gets Real
hooks: The AI war between US and China just got real - this week's moves
China just made a move that has Silicon Valley scared
The AI cold war is heating up and it affects all of us
screen_captions: US vs China: AI Cold War escalates
The chip war meets AI competition
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: DeepSeek AI model performance charts] "China just released DeepSeek, an AI model that performs close to GPT-4 but costs 95% less to run. Silicon Valley is panicking." [SHOW: US chip export restrictions headlines] "The US responded by tightening chip export restrictions. No more advanced GPUs to China. But here's the problem - DeepSeek was built with older, cheaper chips." [SHOW: Stock market reaction to DeepSeek] "Nvidia stock dropped 17% in one day because investors realized you don't need $40,000 GPUs to build competitive AI. The entire AI bubble might be overvalued." [SHOW: European AI companies caught in middle] "And Europe is caught in the middle. We're dependent on both US chips and increasingly competitive Chinese AI models." [SHOW: Text overlay: "What does this mean for startups?"] "For AI entrepreneurs like me, this is actually good news. Cheaper, more efficient AI models mean lower costs and more innovation. Competition drives progress."
scripts.notes: DeepSeek is real Chinese AI model. Nvidia stock reaction and chip restrictions are factual.

scripts.title: Everyone's Building AI Agents Wrong
hooks: Everyone's building AI agents wrong - here's the 3 mistakes
You're doing AI automation backwards and it's costing you money
I've seen 100 AI agent projects fail. Here's why.
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Failed AI agent dashboard] "I've consulted on over 100 AI agent projects. 90% of them fail, and it's always the same three mistakes." [SHOW: Complex workflow diagram] "Mistake one - they try to automate everything at once. I saw a company try to build an AI agent that handled sales, support, and accounting. It sucked at all three." [SHOW: AI hallucination examples] "Mistake two - no human oversight. AI agents hallucinate. A client's AI agent sent a refund email to every customer because it misunderstood a complaint." [SHOW: Simple, focused AI workflow] "Mistake three - not starting small. The best AI agents do one thing really well. My most successful client started with just email classification." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Start small, scale smart"] "Here's the right way: pick one repetitive task, build an AI agent for just that, add human checkpoints, then scale. Don't try to replace humans - augment them."
scripts.notes: Based on Albert's real consulting experience. 100+ projects is realistic for his business.

scripts.title: You're Using ChatGPT Like a Search Engine
hooks: You're using ChatGPT like a search engine. Stop.
This is why your ChatGPT results suck
You're wasting ChatGPT's potential and here's how to fix it
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Bad ChatGPT prompt example] "I see people asking ChatGPT 'What's the best AI tool?' That's like asking a creative writing assistant for Wikipedia facts." [SHOW: Good ChatGPT conversation example] "ChatGPT isn't a search engine - it's a reasoning engine. Instead of asking 'What's the best AI tool?' ask 'I need to automate email responses for a small e-commerce business. What should I consider?'" [SHOW: Comparison of search vs reasoning prompts] "See the difference? One is looking for information, the other is asking for analysis and reasoning based on your specific situation." [SHOW: Custom GPT with specific context] "Even better - create custom GPTs with your business context. I have one trained on my consulting methodology that gives personalized advice to my clients." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Context is everything"] "The magic happens when you give ChatGPT context about your specific situation. It's not Google - it's like having a really smart consultant who can reason through your problems."
scripts.notes: Common mistake Albert sees in consulting. Good educational content angle.

scripts.title: Mac Mini AI Agent Setup Reality Check
hooks: People are spending $1000 on Mac Minis for AI agents. Here's what they're not telling you.
The Mac Mini AI agent trend is mostly marketing hype
Before you buy a Mac Mini for AI, watch this
screen_captions: Mac Mini AI agents: Reality vs hype
The truth about local AI hardware
scripts.full_script: [SHOW: Mac Mini M4 product page] "Everyone's hyping Mac Minis for running AI agents locally. $1000 for an M4 Mac Mini sounds like a great deal until you realize what you actually get." [SHOW: AI model performance comparison] "The M4 chip can run smaller models like Llama 3.1 8B, but it's still 10x slower than cloud APIs and the quality isn't close to GPT-4 or Claude." [SHOW: Cost comparison over time] "Here's the math - $1000 upfront plus electricity costs about $15/month. OpenAI API for the same workload? Maybe $50/month but with way better results." [SHOW: Cloud vs local AI pros/cons] "Local AI makes sense for privacy-sensitive data or if you're processing massive volumes. But for most businesses? You're better off with cloud APIs." [SHOW: Text overlay: "Buy for the right reasons"] "Don't buy a Mac Mini because some YouTuber said it's the future. Buy it because your specific use case requires local processing. The cloud is still cheaper and better for most AI work."
scripts.notes: Counter-narrative to Mac Mini hype. Albert uses cloud APIs for his consulting business.
